revision.text:
{{talk header}} {{User:WildBot/m04|sect={{User:WildBot/m03|1|Counter-intelligence#Offensive counterintelligence|offensive counterintelligence|#Offensive counterintelligence}}, {{User:WildBot/m03|1|SIGINT#Defensive SIGINT|specialized technical interception}}|m04}} {{WikiProjectBannerShell|1= {{WikiProject Espionage|class=start|importance=low}} {{WikiProject Intelligence|class=start|importance=low}} {{WPMILHIST|class=Start| |B-Class-1=no |B-Class-2=yes |B-Class-3=yes |B-Class-4=yes |B-Class-5=yes |Intel-task-force=yes}} }} {{AmE}} ==Archived discussion==
:''The following discussion is an archived debate of the {{{type|proposal}}}. '''Please do not modify it.''' Subsequent comments should be made in a new section on the talk page. No further edits should be made to this section. '' {{{result|The result of the debate was}}} '''don't move'''. —[[User:Nightstallion|Nightst]][[User:Nightstallion/esperanza|a]][[User:Nightstallion|llion]] [[User talk:Nightstallion|''(?)'']] [[Wikipedia:WikiProject Elections and Referenda|''Seen this already?'']] 07:47, 28 April 2006 (UTC) Counterintelligence vs. Counter-intelligence? The community uses the former. —Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[User:67.171.210.45|67.171.210.45]] ([[User talk:67.171.210.45|talk]] • [[Special:Contributions/67.171.210.45|contribs]]) 02:40, 28 May 2005 why is "mole hunt" not an artical or a redirrect to this artical, and can someone take care of that. —Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/129.15.127.225|129.15.127.225]] ([[User talk:129.15.127.225|talk]]) 04:20, 7 May 2009 (UTC) ==Requested move== Counter-intelligence → Counterintelligence – more common usage (even in this article) [[User:Akrabbim|Akrabbim]] 20:13, 23 April 2006 (UTC) : [copied from WP:RM by [[User:Jdforrester|James F.]] [[User talk:Jdforrester|(talk)]] 20:38, 23 April 2006 (UTC)] ===Survey=== :''Add *'''Support''' or *'''Oppose''' followed by an optional one-sentence explanation, then sign your opinion with ''~~~~ * '''Oppose'''; this looks like an AE/BE issue, here. [[User:Jdforrester|James F.]] [[User talk:Jdforrester|(talk)]] 20:39, 23 April 2006 (UTC) ===Discussion=== :''Add any additional comments'' If it's really a matter of [[AE/BE differences]] or similar (which I'm guessing is the case), then so long as there's a redirect from the other name, it doesn't matter which name is used. [[User:Andrewa|Andrewa]] 00:20, 28 April 2006 (UTC) AFAIK it is. —[[User:Nightstallion|Nightst]][[User:Nightstallion/esperanza|a]][[User:Nightstallion|llion]] [[User talk:Nightstallion|''(?)'']] [[Wikipedia:WikiProject Elections and Referenda|''Seen this already?'']] 07:47, 28 April 2006 (UTC) :''The above discussion is preserved as an archive of the debate. '''Please do not modify it.''' Subsequent comments should be made in a new section on this talk page. No further edits should be made to this section.
== Military c-e == In many countries army has its own c-e, see [[Główny Zarząd Informacji Wojska Polskiego]] in Communist Poland. [[User:Xx236|Xx236]] 15:25, 7 December 2006 (UTC) == Spelling!! == Counterintelligence is ONE word... Not hyphenated. ==Spelling X2== Counterintelligence is ONE word... Not hyphenated. I would agree. == Counterintelligence == Counterintelligence is the accepted spelling for the United States' military and civilian programs. References include the National Counterintelligence Executive (NCIX), the now disestablished Counterintelligence Field Activity (CIFA), and INSCOM. [[User:Netherper|Netherper]] ([[User talk:Netherper|talk]]) 10:22, 22 August 2008 (UTC) Counterintelligence is a very important word, when you are planning to take action against any hostile enemies. For an example, during the vietnam war. There was a large movement of China Red Army, estimation unknown, destination unknown. Because of the forest covering the Loas, and other parts of that area. The China Red Army vanished the satelite. We didn't know where they were. So, the U.S. Army in Vietnam were notified by the Washington to search for a heavy resistence or heavy concentration of the resistence inside of Loas. U.S. Army iniated a search and destory mission within the Target Area. U.S. Army counterintelligence did reported that there was a very concentration of resistence somewhere in Loas. U.S. Air force initiated carpet bombing using 50 B-52's High Attitude Jet Bombers for 5 days. After the bombing, on April 26, 1972-everything was quiet at the western front. We won Vietnam on that date, we were not to win the war based upon the population control for Vietnam. Frankly, We Won, We Lost the War, Just to Answer the Population Control. —Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[User:Jesuitmilitarychaplain|Jesuitmilitarychaplain]] ([[User talk:Jesuitmilitarychaplain|talk]] • [[Special:Contributions/Jesuitmilitarychaplain|contribs]]) 23:35, 29 December 2008 (UTC) == Dividing out the sections == Recommend moving Offensive Counterintelligence to OFCO and creating a separate entry. The same with counterespionage (CE) and other activities such as CFSO and formerly LLSO and MSO. == Could Edward Snowdens archives have led us to this point? Explanation of situation in Ukraine, and loss of 'sea range' in pacific theatre indicates resource grabs indicative of global conflict. Pre emptive knowledge of Ukraine coup smells of merge plot. == [[Special:Contributions/74.81.235.84|74.81.235.84]] ([[User talk:74.81.235.84|talk]]) 14:51, 17 June 2015 (UTC) Timeline to disclosure in question... If he was an inactive Russian explain the later leak of coup favorite on timeline with other leaks... Then determine the value of information sold to China by Vlady. Well worth exorbitant fee. Even if idiot was clean KGB would drain the library from him without his knowing.[[Special:Contributions/74.81.235.84|74.81.235.84]] ([[User talk:74.81.235.84|talk]]) 14:51, 17 June 2015 (UTC) I would.[[Special:Contributions/74.81.235.84|74.81.235.84]] ([[User talk:74.81.235.84|talk]]) 14:51, 17 June 2015 (UTC)
